intro: Hieracium subdoronicifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. It is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
